dublinCore.dc:title: 110 HR 1471 IH: Better Access to Chiropractors to Keep our Veterans Healthy Act (BACK Veterans Health Act)
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Filner introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to permit eligible veterans to receive direct access to chiropractic care.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Better Access to Chiropractors to Keep our Veterans Healthy Act (BACK Veterans Health Act).

section.header: Expanded chiropractor services available to veterans

subsection.text: Paragraph (6) of section 1701 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:
Paragraph (8) of such section is amended by inserting chiropractic, after counseling,.
Paragraph (9) of such section is amended —

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (F) through (K) as subparagraphs (G) through (L), respectively; and
by inserting after subparagraph (E) the following new subparagraph (F):

subparagraph.text: periodic and preventative chiropractic examinations and services;

section.header: Direct access for veterans to chiropractic services

subsection.text: Chapter 17 of title 38, is amended by inserting after section 1710B the following new section:

The Secretary shall permit eligible veterans to receive needed medical services, rehabilitative services, and preventative health services from a licensed doctor of chiropractic on a direct access basis at the election of the eligible veteran, if such services are within the State scope of practice of such doctor of chiropractic.
The Secretary shall not discriminate among licensed health-care providers in the determination of needed services.
The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 1710B the following new item:
